alert.note: Alert for Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 9:52AM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ***STRONG WINDS AND HEAVY SNOW ACROSS THE SACRAMENTO MOUNTAINS*** At 9:47 MDT, current webcam imagery shows moderate to heavy snow and strong winds across Cloudcroft, NM. A trained spotter reported 2 to 3 inches on the ground, with an inch or two more expected in the next few hours. Trecherous travel is expected across HWY-82 leading up to Cloudcroft due to snow covered roadways and low visibility, and across other locations above 7500 ft in the Sacramento mountains. Heavy snow should taper off in the next hour or two, with a few snow showers lingering into the afternoon hours.
